data.content:
noun
also premire , pl -mieres also -mires
[count] :the first time a film, play, television show, etc., is shown or performed
The movie will have its premiere next week.
We saw the Chicago premiere of the play. [=the first public performance of the play in Chicago]
the world premiere [=the first public performance anywhere in the world] of a new symphony Do not confuse premiere with premier.
verb
also premire -mieres also -mires; -miered also -mired; -miering also -miring
[no obj] of a movie, play, television show, etc. :to be shown or performed for the first time
The movie/play premieres next week.
[+ obj] :to show or perform (a movie, play, television show, etc.) for the first time - usually used as (be) premiered
The movie was premiered at a film festival.
